main event: A round object emitting fireballs of different colors was observed by a control tower operator at Dobbins AFB, Georgia on October 13, 1953.
interesting points: The object was stationary and observed for 2 hours and 30 minutes,It was spotted approximately six miles away from the Control Tower,The object emitted flashes of colored light and appeared on radar,The operator reported that the object did not have wings and did not give off exhaust or vapor trails,Military investigations concluded the sighting was caused by auto lights or a searchlight.
witness description: control tower operator at Dobbins AFB
